thread.title: The 10 best things to do in Grenada
thread.title_full: The 10 best things to do in Grenada

title: The 10 best things to do in Grenada
text:
The 10 best things to do in Grenada The 10 best things to do in Grenada FROM stunning beaches to unspoiled wildlife and delicious, colourful food, Greanada has everything to be the perfect summer holiday destination. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sat, Aug 8, 2015 GETTY Explore the island’s capital, St George’s 
1. Explore the island’s capital, St George’s and stock up on flavourings at the spice market while sipping fresh coconut water. 
2. Take a scuba yoga course with Aquanauts at True Blue Bay Resort, aimed at helping divers improve their breathing, posture and overall experience. Email: yoga@truebluebay.com. 
3. Visit during the annual Grenada Chocolate Festival in May. See grenadachocolatefest.com . 
4. Visit BB’s Crabback, whose owner Brian Benjamin has created a feast for the eyes and taste buds, with dishes such as goat curry. 
5. Learn more about spices at nutmeg plantation Dougaldston Spice Estate and the Gouyave Nutmeg Processing Station. GETTY Quench your thirst with a rum punch after a tour of the River Antoine Rum Distillery 
6. Take part in a walk or run with the Hash House Harriers and meet some locals at the same time. 
7. Ditch the menu and allow Ms Karen to dazzle you with her Caribbean cooking at Patrick’s Local Home Style Restaurant. Dishes are tapas style, but with 18 in total, you won’t leave feeling hungry. 
8. Head to the Owl bar on Grand Anse Beach to compete in crab racing every Monday and Friday. See owlgrenada.com . 
9. Donate to the Sandals Foundation which helps local communities, especially disadvantaged children and those needing healthcare. See sandalsfoundation.org . 
10. Quench your thirst with a rum punch after a tour of the River Antoine Rum Distillery. Dating from 1785, this is the oldest functioning water-powered distillery in the Caribbean. Related articles
